title: Rhyce Power reveals what he thinks of ex Vanessa Sierra appearing on Love Island Australia
text:
It seems there's no love lost between Married At First Sight's 'hot brother' Rhyce Power and his model ex-girlfriend Vanessa Sierra.

The personal trainer finally addressed Vanessa's appearance on Love Island Australia on Monday, telling his Instagram followers he doesn't watch the show.

Bizarrely, he also pretended to not know who she is, despite the fact they dated for several months and she filed an intervention order against him.

'This question has come up quite a lot,' he said during an Instagram Story Q&A after a fan had asked him, 'What do you think of Vanessa on Love Island?'

'Vanessa who? I don't watch Love Island so I'm not too sure who they're talking about. Who is Vanessa?' he added.

Rhyce and Vanessa dated for several months at the start of the year, before ending things in March.

'Vanessa who?' Married At First Sight's Rhyce Power (left) has finally revealed what he thinks of his ex-girlfriend Vanessa Sierra (right) appearing on Love Island Australia

Following their split, Vanessa alleged that Rhyce had assaulted her during a fitness holiday in Thailand.

She later filed an intervention order in Australia.

Under the Victorian intervention order, which is similar to an apprehended violence order (AVO), the heavily-tattooed tradesman is banned from contacting Vanessa.

Tumultuous romance: Bizarrely, Rhyce pretended to not know who Vanessa is, despite the fact they dated for several months and she filed an intervention order against him

In a lengthy statement shared to Instagram in April, Rhyce said there was more to the story and appeared to deny Vanessa's claims.

'There's always two sides to every story, and everyone needs to believe that,' he said.

Earlier this month, Vanessa discussed the pair's relationship in an interview with TV Week, admitting she 'ignored the red flags'.

Former flames: Rhyce and Vanessa dated for several months at the start of the year, before ending things in March. Following their split, Vanessa alleged that Rhyce had assaulted her during a fitness holiday in Thailand

'Now I'd say trust your gut if you've got a bad feeling,' she said.

Vanessa added that, seven months after the break-up, she was excited about 'moving forward' with her life.

Love Island Australia continues Tuesday at 8:40pm on Channel Nine

'There are two sides': In a lengthy statement shared to Instagram in April, Rhyce said there was more to the story and appeared to deny Vanessa's claims
description: It seems there's no love lost between Married At First Sight's 'hot brother' Rhyce Power and his model ex-girlfriend Vanessa Sierra.
authors: Monique Friedlander For Daily Mail Australia
